p: ii) Data from qualitative samples of E. analoga collected during spring low tides of December 1999â€”February 2000 at 23 sandy beaches along the Chilean coast (no samples were collected at El Aguila, Hornitos and El Apolillado; Fig 1B). Samples were collected from visible aggregations of E. analoga in the swash zone using a shovel. All crabs were separated from the sand by sieving through a 1-mm mesh. The sampling continued for at least 20 minutes at each site until more than 100 crabs representing a full range of sizes were collected. The specimens collected were stored in 5% formalin until sorted and measured in the laboratory.
